title: QA Tester
description:
#### **Job Overview**


Do you like to test large applications that serve a huge customer base with constantly growing demand and usage?


We are seeking a QA Tester whose primary responsibility will be to run and test systems, applications and software products to identify issues.


You should report all the bugs and execute test cases efficiently. Your ultimate goal will be to make sure that all our systems and apps work smoothly without any glitch.


If you consider yourself competent enough to carry out this role successfully, this job is for you.


#### **Responsibilities**

* Running and testing new apps and software.
* Executing all levels of QA tests that are System, Integration, and Regression.
* Developing test design, test process, test data, test automation, and test cases and prioritizing test activities.
* Analyzing the system and ensuring the test strategy is aligned with the requirements of the development process.
* Executing and clearly documenting test plans (not just the test cases) for the module covering all aspects of testing for software quality.
* Identifying bugs and creating reports to highlight the status of all modules.
* Updating all bug databases with accurate and complete information.
* Running debug programs to fix the defects.
* Coordinating with the development team of Software QA Engineers and Software Test Manager for the development of effective test plans and strategies.
* Making improvements to the system throughout the software development phase.
* Dealing with the maintenance of test environments.

#### **Requirements**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent.
* 2\\-5 years of relevant experience in QA Engineer, Software Tester or a similar role.
* Professional Certifications like ISTQB and CTFL Certifications will be preferred.
* Strong understanding of Software Development methodologies like Agile, Defect Management System, Quality Assurance and documentation.
* Excellent knowledge of Selenium IDE, Selenium web driver, NUnit, Loadrunner, JMeter, etc.
* Outstanding knowledge designing and writing automation test scripts.
* Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
* Exceptional understanding of Database testing SQL.
* Working knowledge of software programming languages.
* Excellent organizational and project management skills.
* Good oral and written communication skills
* Effective time management.
* Strong critical thinking.
* Ability to solve complex problems.

title: Game QA Tester
description:
**Game QA**
===========


**Location:** Bangalore  

**Employment Type:** Full\\-time (On\\-site), Normal Day timings


### **About**



Our client is a mobile game development studio creating **high\\-quality word puzzle games for a global audience**. Our games focus on **visual fidelity, smooth functionality, and engaging gameplay**, matching the standards of the worlds top mobile games. We are passionate about delivering seamless user experiences that delight players everywhere.


### **Role Overview**



As a **Game Tester**, you will play a critical role in ensuring the **quality, stability, and performance** of our mobile games. You will work closely with developers, designers, and product managers to identify bugs, verify fixes, and ensure the game feels polished and enjoyable for players across devices and regions.


### **Key Responsibilities**


* Test mobile word puzzle games across multiple devices, OS versions, and screen resolutions.
* Identify, log, and track bugs, glitches, or usability issues with clear documentation.
* Verify fixes and conduct regression testing to ensure no new issues are introduced.
* Evaluate **UI/UX, animations, performance, and game functionality** against global top game benchmarks.
* Collaborate with developers and designers to reproduce and troubleshoot reported issues.
* Contribute to test plans and suggest improvements to enhance game quality and player experience.
* Provide feedback on gameplay balance, difficulty, and user engagement from a players perspective.

### **Requirements**


* Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Game Design, or related field (preferred, not mandatory).
* 2 \\- 4 years of experience in **game testing** (mobile testing experience required).
* Strong knowledge of **mobile platforms (iOS \\& Android)** and mobile testing tools.
* Familiarity with bug tracking tools such as **JIRA, Trello, or Bugzilla**.
* Good understanding of **UI/UX, performance optimization, and player experience**.
* Excellent attention to detail, communication, and documentation skills.
* Passion for games, especially puzzle or word games, with an eye for quality.

title: Software Tester (Manual)
description:
**Job Summary:**  
We are looking for a detail\\-oriented **Software Tester (Manual/Automation)** to ensure the quality, performance, and reliability of our software products. The ideal candidate will have experience in both manual and automated testing and a strong understanding of the software development lifecycle.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design, develop, and execute test cases for web, mobile, and desktop applications.
* Perform manual testing for functional, regression, integration, and system testing.
* Develop, maintain, and execute automated test scripts using tools like Selenium, QTP, or similar.
* Identify, record, track, and report bugs and issues using bug tracking tools (e.g., JIRA).
* Collaborate with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to ensure software quality.
* Participate in requirement analysis and contribute to the test strategy.
* Ensure timely execution of testing activities and meet project deadlines.
* Continuously improve testing processes, tools, and best practices.

**Required Skills \\& Qualifications:**

* Strong knowledge of SDLC, STLC, and QA methodologies.
* Hands\\-on experience with testing tools like Selenium, Postman, JIRA, or similar.

title: Manual QA Engineer II

We’re proud that more organizations continue to leverage our technology every day to become truly data\\-driven.

We are looking for a QA Engineer who will focus on solving complex testing difficulties by designing and executing test plans, test scenarios and test cases. The engineer will invest in improving the testing process at Fivetran. The ideal candidate will be highly technical, detail\\-oriented, creative, motivated, and focused on achieving results.



This is a full\\-time position based out of our Bangalore office. Our hybrid work model offers a blend of remote flexibility and in\\-person collaboration, including two days in the office each week to connect and build as a team.

* Exp with Database setup
* Experience in creating or maintaining automation tests is a huge plus

Job Description: QA Tester (Manual Testing Focused)

We are looking for a QA Tester to assess software quality through manual testing as the primary responsibility, with exposure to automated testing considered a plus. You will be responsible for identifying bugs, reporting issues, and ensuring the delivery of high\\-quality software.

The ideal candidate is detail\\-oriented, passionate about software testing, and driven to improve product quality. You will work closely with development and product teams to ensure robust and reliable applications are released to production.

Key Responsibilities

* Review and analyze system specifications and requirements.
* Execute manual test cases for software applications (functional, regression, integration, performance).

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or equivalent experience.
* 1–3 years of experience in Quality Assurance or Software Testing with strong manual testing skills (mandatory).
* Solid understanding of SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) and testing methodologies.

* Familiarity with bug tracking and defect management.
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills.

* Supportive leadership and a transparent feedback culture.

title: AI Tester
description:
Job Summary:  



As a Tester AI Application Development at Emerson, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of AI\\-driven applications by testing, verifying, and validating the software through automated and manual testing methods. You will work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and other collaborators to improve the performance and usability of AI applications.  



In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:


* Design and implement detailed test plans and test cases for AI\\-based applications to ensure the functionality, performance, and security meet the standards and requirements
* Conduct rigorous tests on AI\\-based applications, including generative models, AI Assistant/AI agent platforms, and machine learning algorithms, to assess their effectiveness, accuracy, and usability
* Identify, document, and report defects, bugs, and AI behavior anomalies. Test for AI's response consistency, context understanding, and the ability to generate relevant outputs; collaborating with the development team to resolve issues
* Develop and implement automated test scripts for AI models, ensuring scalability and efficiency in testing
* Work with data engineers, data scientists, and development teams to prepare test data for training, validation, and testing of AI models
* Conduct functional testing, regression testing, load testing, and performance testing for AI\\-powered applications; ensuring no regression issues or performance drops after model retraining or new version releases
* Assist in training and fine\\-tuning AI models based on real\\-world user feedback and test results. Provide validation to ensure ethical AI standards are met
* Identify, document, and report defects found during the testing phases, collaborating with the development team to resolve issues
* Analyze and validate the performance of machine learning models and AI outputs critically, identify biases, edge cases through testing and ensure that the application meets the encouraged accuracy, precision, and other performance metrics
* Contribute to improving the overall QA processes and testing frameworks used for AI development
* Maintain detailed documentation of test procedures, test cases, and testing results for accountability and repeatability.
Perform exploratory testing to uncover potential issues with AI application features and functionality  
* 

Who You Are:


* Cross\\-functional teammate
* Detailed, organized, flexible, and proactive teammate
* Willing to accept feedback and implement changes quickly and with a positive attitude

description:

QA Tester
  
  

**Location:** Remote \\| Type: Full\\-time
  
  

About Newpage Solutions
  
  

Newpage Solutions is a global digital health innovation company helping people live longer, healthier lives. We partner with life sciences organizations—including pharmaceutical, biotech, and healthcare leaders—to build transformative AI and data\\-driven technologies addressing real\\-world health challenges.
  
  

From strategy and research to UX design and agile development, we deliver and validate impactful solutions using lean, human\\-centered practices.
  
  

We are proud to be Great Place to Work® certified for three consecutive years, hold a top Glassdoor rating, and were named among the "Top 50 Most Promising Healthcare Solution Providers" by CIOReview.
  
  

As a remote\\-first company, we foster creativity, continuous learning, and inclusivity, creating an environment where bold ideas thrive and make a measurable difference in people’s lives.
  
  

Newpage looks for candidates who are invested in long\\-term impact. Applications with a pattern of frequent job changes may not align with the values we prioritize.
  
  

Your Mission
  
  

We are seeking a detailed\\-oriented offshore QA Engineer to support quality assurance activities for our projects involving Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Adobe Workfront Fusion integrations. This role will focus on validating workflow, integrations, and web content delivery to ensure robust, high\\-quality solutions for our end users.
  
  

What You’ll Do
  
  

Develop and execute comprehensive test plans, test cases, and test scripts for Workfront, Workfront fusion integrations, AEM applications
  
Validate tool specific solutions as well as end to end workflows, API integrations, data flows from Workfront to AEM
  
Perform functional and non\\-functional, integration, regression, and UAT support testing
  
Participate in all Scrum meetings
  
Be empowered to share thoughts, suggestions for continuous improvements
  
Collaborate closely with offshore Delivery teams (PO, Dev leads)
  
Identify, document and track defects using Jira
  
Practice as per the Digital Ways of working to support optimal delivery and consistent reporting
  
  

What You Bring
  
  

Strong experience in manual and /or automated testing (pytest) for web applications and systems integrations
  
Familiarity with Adobe Tools – Workfront, Fusion, AEM are preferred
  
Good understanding of Integration testing principles, data validations
  
Excellent attention to detail, problem solving skills
  
Strong understanding of Agile, Scrum
  
Experience with QA tools such as TestRail, Postman, Chrome DevTools for frontend debugging and troubleshoot
  
Any Adobe related certifications are preferred, but not necessary
  
Experience working across multiple timezones and cultures
  
  

What We Offer
  
  

At Newpage, we’re building a company that works smart and grows with agility—where driven individuals come together to do work that matters. We offer:
  
  

Flexible, remote\\-first work – Choose where you work best while staying connected to a global, collaborative team.
  
A people\\-first culture – Supportive peers, open communication, and a strong sense of belonging.
  
Smart, purposeful collaboration – Work with talented colleagues to create technologies that solve meaningful business challenges.
  
Balance that lasts – We respect your time and support a healthy integration of work and life.
  
Room to grow – Opportunities for learning, leadership, and career development, shaped around you.
  
Meaningful rewards – Competitive compensation that recognizes both contribution and potential.
  
  

Ready to Apply?
  
  

Let’s build the future of health together. Apply below or reach out to Shilpa.shetty@newpage.com with any questions.
  
  

More about Newpage
  
  

Newpage is a digital health solutions company. We devote ourselves to advancing the quality of life by enhancing health and optimizing the longevity of people. We do this by, passionately building futuristic technologies for global organizations across the healthcare ecosystem. We partake at every stage from problem definition, strategy \\& service design, user research, UX design, and agile software development – utilizing lean practices to deliver and validate highly innovative digital health solutions that drive user value and business transformation.
  
  

Newpage is recognized by ‘CIO’s Review’ as “Top 50 Promising Healthcare Solution Providers” and Great Place to Work Certified (GPTW) 2023 \\& 2024\\.

title: Senior ETL QA Engineer
description:
About Us
Zelis is modernizing the healthcare financial experience in the United States (U.S.) across payers, providers, and healthcare consumers. We serve more than 750 payers, including the top five national health plans, regional health plans, TPAs and millions of healthcare providers and consumers across our platform of solutions. Zelis sees across the system to identify, optimize, and solve problems holistically with technology built by healthcare experts – driving real, measurable results for clients.
Why We Do What We Do
In the U.S., consumers, payers, and providers face significant challenges throughout the healthcare financial journey. Zelis helps streamline the process by offering solutions that improve transparency, efficiency, and communication among all parties involved. By addressing the obstacles that patients face in accessing care, navigating the intricacies of insurance claims, and the logistical challenges healthcare providers encounter with processing payments, Zelis aims to create a more seamless and effective healthcare financial system.
Zelis India plays a crucial role in this mission by supporting various initiatives that enhance the healthcare financial experience. The local team contributes to the development and implementation of innovative solutions, ensuring that technology and processes are optimized for efficiency and effectiveness. Beyond operational expertise, Zelis India cultivates a collaborative work culture, leadership development, and global exposure, creating a dynamic environment for professional growth. With hybrid work flexibility, comprehensive healthcare benefits, financial wellness programs, and cultural celebrations, we foster a holistic workplace experience. Additionally, the team plays a vital role in maintaining high standards of service delivery and contributes to Zelis’ award\\-winning culture.
Position Overview
Job Title: QA / ETL Tester
Responsibilities:
ETL Testing: Develop and implement comprehensive test plans and strategies for ETL processes, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and completeness in the data warehouse.
Data Validation: Validate data at various stages of the ETL process, including data extraction, transformation, and loading, to ensure the integrity of the data warehouse.
Test Automation: Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts and frameworks to streamline testing processes and enhance efficiency.
Regression Testing: Conduct thorough regression testing to identify and mitigate any potential issues or bugs introduced during the development process.
Performance Testing: Perform performance testing to assess the responsiveness, scalability, and stability of ETL processes and data pipelines, collaborating with the development team to optimize performance.
Collaboration: Work closely with data engineers, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements, identify potential risks, and provide QA insights throughout the development lifecycle.
Documentation: Create detailed test cases, test reports, and documentation to facilitate effective communication and knowledge sharing within the team.  

Data Warehouse Concepts: Apply knowledge of dimensional modeling and data warehouse concepts, such as star schemas, snowflakes, dimensions, and facts, in the testing process.
Sign\\-offs: Ensure all sign\\-offs on deliverables (overall test strategy, test plan, test cases) and that testing meets governance requirements.
Quality Assurance: Ensure the quality of work and the work of the entire development team.
Data Analysis: Write and execute queries to validate data and troubleshoot erroneous results, logging defects, and working with the development team to resolve software\\-related defects.  

Technical Skills:
ETL Tools: Experience with ETL tools and frameworks, preferably with Azure Data Factory and DBT.  

Cloud Platforms: Proficiency in using Snowflake for data warehousing.  

API Testing: Experience with API testing tools such as Postman, SoapUI, or similar.  

SQL and Scripting: Proficiency in SQL and scripting for data validation and test case data comparison.  

Automation: Experience in test automation using tools like Selenium WebDriver, pytest, or similar.  

Agile/Scrum: Understanding of Agile/Scrum development principles.  

Data Integration: Knowledge of data integration techniques and best practices.  

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.  

5\\-8 years of experience in quality assurance, with a focus on ETL and data warehousing.  

Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data warehousing concepts.  

Experience with cloud data platforms, preferably Snowflake.  

Familiarity with ETL tools like Azure Data Factory and DBT.  

Knowledge of software testing best practices, methodologies, and tools.  

Excellent analytical and problem\\-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex issues and provide effective solutions.  

Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross\\-functional teams and stakeholders.  

Experience or familiarity with healthcare domain concepts and regulations is a plus.

title: Executive – QA
description:
Company: Bayfield Food Ingredients Pvt. Ltd.

Job Title: Executive – QA

Department: Quality Assurance

Education: B.Sc. / M.Sc. / B.Tech in Food Technology

Job Location: Factory (Angamaly)

Reports To: QA Lead

Minimum Work Experience Required: 2–3 Years

Key ResponsibilitiesSkills: regulations,food safety,quality control
• Quality Control (QC)
• Conduct routine analysis of raw materials, packaging materials, in-process, and finished products.
• Ensure all products meet the specified quality parameters before release.
• Maintain sampling protocols and conduct sensory evaluations where required.
• In-Process Quality Control (IPQC)
• Monitor critical control points (CCPs) during production.
• Conduct real-time process checks to ensure adherence to product quality standards.
• Identify and report process deviations and assist in root cause analysis.
• Maintain and update QC and IPQC records as per SOPs.
• Documentation & Compliance
• Prepare and maintain documentation and records for internal, external, and third-party audits.
• Ensure documentation complies with FSSAI, HACCP, ISO 22000, and other regulatory standards.
• Support the development and review of SOPs and quality manuals.
• Assist in internal and external audits, including documentation and CAPA (Corrective & Preventive Actions).
• Coordination & Reporting
• Coordinate with production, QA, and warehouse teams to ensure smooth workflow.
• Prepare and submit daily/weekly QC reports to the QC Manager.
• Audits (Regulatory / Customer / Certification Bodies)
• Participate actively in audits conducted by regulatory bodies (FSSAI), customers, and certification bodies (e.g., BRC, ISO, FSSC).
• Coordinate with departments to ensure audit readiness and timely closure of non-conformities.
• Assist in implementation and monitoring of CAPA post-audit.
• Regulatory Compliance
• Ensure adherence to local and national food safety regulations (FSSAI, Legal Metrology, etc.).
• Stay updated with changes in food safety and quality regulations and recommend necessary changes in internal processes.
• Coordinate product registration, label review, and regulatory submissions when required.
• Support traceability and recall procedures as per regulatory and company guidelines.

Job Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Software Engineer in Test to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in test automation, with proficiency in either Java or Python. The candidate should be familiar with BDD frameworks such as Cucumber or Behave, and have experience in writing tests for a distributed system involving UI, APIs and/or Database. Key Responsibilities: Develop and maintain automated test scripts using Java or Python. Implement and execute automated tests for web UI using Selenium. Utilize BDD frameworks like Cucumber or Behave to create and manage test cases. Collaborate with development and QA teams to ensure comprehensive test coverage. Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines. Use Docker and Kubernetes for test environment setup and management. Analyze test results, identify issues, and work with developers to resolve them. Continuously improve test automation frameworks and processes. Document test cases, test scripts, and test results. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Proven experience in test automation using Java or Python. Familiarity with BDD frameworks such as Cucumber or Behave. Experience in writing automated tests for web UIs. Knowledge of Docker containerization and Kubernetes. Strong understanding of data structures. Experience with CI/CD tools and processes. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Good to Have: Experience with other test automation tools and frameworks. Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud. Familiarity with performance testing and tools like JMeter or LoadRunner. Experience with version control systems like Git. Understanding of Agile methodologies and practices. Familiarity with design patterns.

What We Believe:

We’re proud to embrace the same values that have shaped UST since the beginning. Since day one, we’ve been building enduring relationships and a culture of integrity. And today, it's those same values that are inspiring us to encourage innovation from everyone, to champion diversity and inclusion and to place people at the centre of everything we do.

title: QA Engineer - Web, Backend, and Mobile Automation
description:
As a QA Engineer at our company, you will be joining our talented and passionate team. Your experience in working with mobile apps within a fast-moving business will be crucial as you navigate through the dynamic pace and changes within the company.
• *Key Responsibilities:**
- Design and develop robust automation frameworks for backend, web, and mobile applications.
- Create and execute manual tests for scenarios not easily automated, across web, backend, and kiosk platforms.
- Ensure the quality of release deliverables for your functional areas, guaranteeing timely and high-quality releases.
- Act as a quality gatekeeper with a strong focus on zero defect escapes to production.
- Champion customer-centric testing by understanding real-world use cases and scenarios.
- Continuously improve QA processes and suggest best practices to uplift product quality.
- Identify and define performance/load testing requirements.
- Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced, agile environment.
• *Qualifications Required:**
- 3 to 6 years of experience in quality assurance and automation.
- Strong hands-on experience in at least one programming language (Java, Python, or C++).
- Experience with automation tools such as Selenium, Rest Assured, and Appium.
- Skilled in white-box testing using Java, TestNG, or JUnit.
- Deep understanding of web and REST API testing (manual and automated).
- Strong debugging and problem-solving skills with a mindset for innovation.
- Experience in test planning, strategy, case design, execution, bug tracking, and verification.
- Proficient in using Git or other distributed version control systems.
• *Mobile Testing Expertise:**
- Hands-on experience with mobile test automation tools like Appium, UIAutomator, Espresso, or Robot Framework.
- Familiarity with Android Debug Bridge (ADB) for device-level testing and debugging.
- Solid understanding of mobile testing concepts including touch gestures, network variations, orientation, screen resolution adaptation, and battery/power event handling.
• *Kiosk-Specific Testing Experience (Preferred):**
- Handling auto-launch and lock-down modes.
- Integration testing with peripherals such as barcode scanners, printers, NFC devices.
- Validating system recovery after reboot or crash scenarios.
- Testing idle timeout, screen savers, and other kiosk behavior requirements.

Join our multi-cultural team based in central London, the US, Dubai, and Bangalore, who are revolutionizing the retail industry globally. Experience a collaborative and exciting work environment with the opportunity to impact millions of shoppers through the apps developed for some of the world's largest retailers.,

title: Middle Automation QA Engineer
description:
Company Description

Miratech helps visionaries change the world. We are a global IT services and consulting company that brings together enterprise and start-up innovation. Today, we support digital transformation for some of the world's largest enterprises. By partnering with both large and small players, we stay at the leading edge of technology, remain nimble even as a global leader, and create technology that helps our clients further enhance their business. We are a values-driven organization and our culture of Relentless Performance has enabled over 99% of Miratech's engagements to succeed by meeting or exceeding our scope, schedule, and/or budget objectives since our inception in 1989. Miratech has coverage across 5 continents and operates in over 25 countries around the world. Miratech retains nearly 1000 full-time professionals, and our annual growth rate exceeds 25%.

Job Description

We are looking for a Middle QA Automation Engineer to join our growing quality assurance team. You will build and maintain automated tests for web, API, and mobile applications, ensuring high product quality and smooth releases. This is an excellent opportunity to strengthen your automation skills, work with CI/CD pipelines, and help improve QA processes across the team.

Responsibilities
• Develop, maintain, and execute automated test suites (Selenium, Cypress).
• Perform functional, regression, and integration testing.
• Automate UI and API tests, integrate with CI/CD pipelines (GitLab CI, Jenkins).
• Log and track defects (JIRA) and verify fixes.
• Collaborate with product and engineering teams to clarify requirements.
• Suggest improvements to test coverage and QA processes.

Qualifications
• 3+ years of QA experience, including hands-on automation.
• Strong skills with Selenium, Cypress, or similar frameworks.
• Knowledge of at least one scripting language (JavaScript, Python, or Java).
• Experience with API testing (Postman) and basic SQL.
• Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and version control (Git).
• Good analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

We offer:

• Culture of Relentless Performance: join an unstoppable technology development team with a 99% project success rate and more than 30% year-over-year revenue growth.

• Competitive Pay and Benefits: enjoy a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including health insurance, language courses, and a relocation program.

• Work From Anywhere Culture: make the most of the flexibility that comes with remote work.

• Growth Mindset: reap the benefits of a range of professional development opportunities, including certification programs, mentorship and talent investment programs, internal mobility and internship opportunities.

• Global Impact: collaborate on impactful projects for top global clients and shape the future of industries.

• Welcoming Multicultural Environment: be a part of a dynamic, global team and thrive in an inclusive and supportive work environment with open communication and regular team-building company social events.

• Social Sustainability Values: join our sustainable business practices focused on five pillars, including IT education, community empowerment, fair operating practices, environmental sustainability, and gender equality.
• Miratech is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status under applicable law.

title: Quality Architect Test Automation
description:
EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.

We are seeking a Quality Architect (Test Automation), who are enthusiastic about engineering solutions and technologies. You will plan the full cycle project infrastructure and design, decide which components the product will comprise – either ready, “out of the box” or developed from scratch. For some parts of the solution there will be an opportunity to create proofs-of-concept, participate in pre-sales, consult clients, conduct audits of existing solutions to evaluate their effectiveness and determine whether and how they can be improved.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Design large-scale solutions with deep technical details
• Closely work with business in identifying project requirements
• Perform architecture review/audit
• Establish project necessities and goals to "go-live"solution
• Participate in the full cycle of pre-sale activities
• Provide RFP processing
• Directly communicate with customers during solution architecture design or implementation activities
• Maintain a strong understanding of industry trends and best practices

REQUIREMENTS
• Should have overall 15+years of experience in Automation Testing and 5+ years of experience in solution architecture design
• Advanced level in at least 1 business domain
• Experience in setting up test automation strategy for different domains and projects (T&M and Fixed-Price)
• Expert level of knowledge in Test Automation (frameworks, tools, approaches)
• Strong knowledge of at least 2 programming languages (including 1 scripting language). Preferred ones are: Java, C# .NET, JS
• Strong knowledge of architecture and ability to suggest different automation solutions based on architecture specifics
• Understanding of basics of enterprise and business architecture
• Solid background in design and implementation of external services integrations (using REST/SOAP, microservices, ESB, SOA)
• Strong knowledge of one of the platforms (Java2JEE/.NET/JavaScript/Content Management)
• Experience with multiple full lifecycle software development processes, approaches and methods (Scrum & RUP)
• Deep expertise in web application/web services architectures, relational and non-relational data storage specifics, cross-cutting concerns (security, monitoring, caching, etc.)
• Proactive approach and leadership in architecture engagement
• Experience in customer site assignments
• Must have strong communications skills

WE OFFER
• Opportunity to work on technical challenges that may impact across geographies
• Vast opportunities for self-development: online university, knowledge sharing opportunities globally, learning opportunities through external certifications
• Opportunity to share your ideas on international platforms
• Sponsored Tech Talks & Hackathons
• Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
• Possibility to relocate to any EPAM office for short and long-term projects
• Focused individual development
• Benefit package
• Health benefits
• Retirement benefits
• Paid time off
• Flexible benefits
• Forums to explore beyond work passion (CSR, photography, painting, sports, etc.)

title: Senior Lead Engineer (QA)
description:
Our story

At Alight, we believe a company’s success starts with its people. At our core, we Champion People, help our colleagues Grow with Purpose and true to our name we encourage colleagues to “Be Alight.”

Our Values:

Champion People – be empathetic and help create a place where everyone belongs.

Grow with purpose – Be inspired by our higher calling of improving lives.

Be Alight – act with integrity, be real and empower others.

It’s why we’re so driven to connect passion with purpose. Alight helps clients gain a benefits advantage while building a healthy and financially secure workforce by unifying the benefits ecosystem across health, wealth, wellbeing, absence management and navigation.

With a comprehensive total rewards package, continuing education and training, and tremendous potential with a growing global organization, Alight is the perfect place to put your passion to work.

Join our team if you Champion People, want to Grow with Purpose through acting with integrity and if you embody the meaning of Be Alight.

Learn more at careers.alight.com.

Job Title: QA-Senior Leader Engineer

Location: Chennai, Gurugram, India

Experience: 8+ years

Job Summary:

We are seeking a hands-on QA-Senior Leader Engineer with over 8 years of experience in manual and automation testing, and exposure to performance testing. The ideal candidate will lead a QA team of 5–10 engineers, be actively involved in Agile delivery cycles, and contribute directly to sprint activities. The QA-Senior Leader Engineer should bring strong leadership, deep technical expertise, and a collaborative mindset to ensure the delivery of high-quality, scalable software solutions.

Key Responsibilities:
• Lead, mentor, and manage a QA team of 5–10 testers (manual and automation).
• Own the quality assurance strategy, planning, and execution across all phases of the SDLC.
• Be hands-on in manual and automation testing – contribute actively during Agile sprints.
• Define and implement robust test plans, test cases, and automation scripts for web, API, and backend services.
• Work closely with developers, product owners, and DevOps to integrate QA processes in CI/CD pipelines.
• Drive test automation strategy using tools such as Selenium, Functionize, or similar frameworks.
• Collaborate with performance testing engineers or contribute to performance testing activities as needed.
• Conduct code reviews for automation scripts and support test data management.
• Track QA metrics, create test reports, and drive quality improvements across the team.
• Foster a culture of continuous improvement, accountability, and innovation in QA practices.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
• 10+ years of QA experience with at least 3+ years in a QA leadership or managerial role.
• Strong experience in both manual testing and test automation.
• Solid exposure to performance testing tools and concepts.
• Deep understanding of Agile methodologies, Scrum ceremonies, and CI/CD pipelines.
• Hands-on experience with automation tools such as Selenium, Functionize, TestNG, JUnit, Postman, or similar.
• Strong knowledge of testing APIs, web applications, and integration workflows.
• Excellent communication, problem-solving, and stakeholder management skills.
• Experience working with defect management and test lifecycle tools like JIRA, TestRail, Zephyr, or similar.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, etc.) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
• Familiarity with BDD/TDD practices and frameworks like Cucumber.
• Exposure to performance testing tools such as JMeter, LoadRunner, or Gatling.
• ISTQB or equivalent certification is a plus.

Alight requires all virtual interviews to be conducted on video.

Flexible Working

So that you can be your best at work and home, we consider flexible working arrangements wherever possible. Alight has been a leader in the flexible workspace and “Top 100 Company for Remote Jobs” 5 years in a row.

Benefits

We offer programs and plans for a healthy mind, body, wallet and life because it’s important our benefits care for the whole person. Options include a variety of health coverage options, wellbeing and support programs, retirement, vacation and sick leave, maternity, paternity & adoption leave, continuing education and training as well as several voluntary benefit options.

By applying for a position with Alight, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Alight’s employment policies. Background checks may include some or all the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.

Our commitment to Inclusion

We celebrate differences and believe in fostering an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and supported. We know that diverse teams are stronger, more innovative, and more successful.

At Alight, we welcome and embrace all individuals, regardless of their background, and are dedicated to creating a culture that enables every employee to thrive. Join us in building a brighter, more inclusive future.

Authorization to work in the Employing Country

Applicants for employment in the country in which they are applying (Employing Country) must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the Employing Country and with Alight.

Note, this job description does not restrict management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities of this job to other entities; including but not limited to subsidiaries, partners, or purchasers of Alight business units.

We offer you a competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

DISCLAIMER:

Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities of this job to other entities; including but not limited to subsidiaries, partners, or purchasers of Alight business units.

title: Lead .NET Automation Test Engineer
description:
EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.

We are seeking a Lead .NET Automation Test Engineer to join our team.

You will play a pivotal role in ensuring the reliability and accuracy of our software systems. Your expertise in implementing API and UI Automation using C# as the programming language, along with your strong knowledge of TestNG, BDD Frameworks in .NET, and Design patterns, will be instrumental in driving the success of our projects.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Collaborate closely with internal teams to gather and analyze system requirements
• Provide prompt feedback on business and technical requirements after thorough review
• Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases in detail
• Coordinate testing activities systematically, prioritizing based on project needs
• Design, develop, and execute automation scripts using C# and advanced automation tools
• Discover, report, document, and track defects with meticulous attention to detail
• Define and enforce quality standards, ensuring adherence throughout the process
• Monitor and improve quality assurance metrics for ongoing enhancement
• Participate actively in QA meetings, providing valuable inputs on testing activities
• Stay updated on emerging testing tools and strategies

REQUIREMENTS
• Minimum of 8 to 12 years of experience in Automation Testing .NET
• 1+ year of relevant leadership experience
• Strong testing basics test process, design techniques, defect management & methodology
• Experience in working in agile model, with Insprint automation preferred
• Proficient in C# programming
• Hands-on experience in implementing API (RestSharp) and UI (Selenium) Automation using C#
• Familiarity with TestNG, NUnit/MSUnit, BDD-Specflow
• Exposure and experience to Design patterns like Singleton, page object, factory
• Experience in automated test suite integration with Continuous integration (Jenkins/Bamboo)
• Strong organizational and problem-solving skills with great attention to detail, critical thinking, solid communication
• B2+ English level proficiency

WE OFFER

title: Senior QE
description:
About Us

We are developers of digital futures! Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive. Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in approximately 90 countries. Tietoevry's annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion, and the company's shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Brs (www.tietoevry.com).

About EVRY USA

EVRY USA delivers IT services to a wide range of customers in the USA through its global delivery centers and India offices (EVRY India) in Bangalore & Chandigarh, India. We offer a comprehensive IT services portfolio and drive digital transformation across Banking & Financial Services, Insurance, Healthcare, Retail & Logistics, and Energy, Utilities & Manufacturing sectors. EVRY India's process and project maturity is very high the two offshore development centers in India are appraised at CMMI DEV Maturity Level 5 & CMMI SVC Maturity Level 5 and certified under ISO 9001:2015 & ISO/IEC 27001:2013.

Roles and Responsibility Senior: Responsibilities
• Develop, enhance, and maintain scalable test automation framework and manual testing processes
• Develop functional and regression automation code from test case requirements
• Triage, diagnose, report, track, and resolve software quality issues
• Ensure the appropriate testing and monitoring tools/ technologies are configured accordingly with the test objectives/ project team requirements
• Identify required improvements in the test and development processes, make contributions to used automation tools, successfully address specific needs
• Communicate effectively across multiple teams to ensure cohesion and collaboration

Requirements
• 7 years of proven experience as a Quality Engineer
• 3 years of experience in building and executing automated tests
• Strong Quality Assurance knowledge: managing testing processes, risk-based testing, testing documentation, and testing techniques.
• Experience with at least one of the following programming languages: Java, Python
• Strong Test Automation fundamentals and hands on experience with automation tools at the End to End, API and Unit testing levels (i.e: Selenium, Cypress, RestAssured, or similar)
• Experience with monitoring tools and performance testing tools.
• Strong Experience in database and ETL testing, preferably with MSSQL, IBM Db2, MariaDB, or SAP ASE/Sybase DB. Experience using QuerySurge is a plus.
• Experience with test automation within CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins or similar
• Knowledge of test case management using qTest or similar
• Excellent spoken and written English
• Strong desire to learn and improve

A significant advantage would be
• ISTQB Foundation Certification
• Experience with Mobile testing, including automation
• Experience or familiarity with Model Driven Testing
• Experience with test case optimization concepts, including Combinatorial Testing and Orthogonal Array Testing
• Experience with Hexawise, ConformIQ or similar tools
• Experience in an Agile development environment

title: QA Integration Engineer
description:
WEKA is architecting a new approach to the enterprise data stack built for the age of reasoning. NeuralMesh by WEKA sets the standard for agentic AI data infrastructure with a cloud and AI-native software solution that can be deployed anywhere. It transforms legacy data silos into data pipelines that dramatically increase GPU utilization and make AI model training and inference, machine learning, and other compute-intensive workloads run faster, work more efficiently, and consume less energy.

WEKA is a pre-IPO, growth-stage company on a hyper-growth trajectory. We’ve raised $375M in capital with dozens of world-class venture capital and strategic investors. We help the world’s largest and most innovative enterprises and research organizations, including 12 of the Fortune 50, achieve discoveries, insights, and business outcomes faster and more sustainably. We’re passionate about solving our customers’ most complex data challenges to accelerate intelligent innovation and business value. If you share our passion, we invite you to join us on this exciting journey.

What You'll Be Doing

As an Integration Engineer at WEKA, you play a critical role in ensuring the quality and excellence of our world-class enterprise products. You’ll be part of an agile development team, working with the team’s developers to execute manual/automation tests and track quality assurance metrics to ensure product quality. You will also be responsible for assuring stable products with delightful usability.

As An Integration Engineer, You’ll
• Test the complete storage solution.
• Design, develop, execute, and maintain test cases and procedures.
• Collaborate with teams to ensure product features are of high quality.
• Implement feedback and enhance coding practices based on reviews.
• Work as an embedded tester within the agile development test to define testing strategies for feature development.
• Work with product management and development teams to define use cases and acceptance testing criteria.
• Develop, execute, and maintain component, integration, regression, performance, stability and scalability tests.
• Identify product issues, write detailed bug reports, and track project quality metrics.

Requirements
• Education: Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or a related engineering field.
• At least 5 years in testing, specifically for storage solutions.
• Proficiency in Python and Shell programming language
• Strong experience in Linux/UNIX environments.
• Knowledge of storage protocols (NFS, SMB, CIFS, S3), RAID, snapshots, and file systems.
• Familiarity with public cloud infrastructures (AWS, GCP, Azure, VMware).
• Understanding of networking concepts, including firewalls and IPv4/IPv6.
• Experience with white-box and black-box testing methodologies.
• Proficiency in functional, system, performance, regression, and integration testing.

It's Nice If You Have
• Knowledge of Kubernetes
• Hands-on experience with deployment, setup, and configuration of complex systems, preferably in the storage domain.
• Strong knowledge of operating system setups and configurations.
• Able to write code, work within user stories, and adhere to coding standards.
• Experience with Git, Jenkins, and Agile software development tools and processes.
• Ability to prioritize defects and determine risk based on objective, metrics-based data.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Strong team player with good communication skills and should be a self-starter
• Excellent time management skills, with the ability to independently prioritize, multitask, and work under deadlines in a fast-paced environment

The WEKA Way
• We are Accountable: We take full ownership, always–even when things don’t go as planned. We lead with integrity, show up with responsibility & ownership, and hold ourselves and each other to the highest standards.
• We are Brave: We question the status quo, push boundaries, and take smart risks when needed. We welcome challenges and embrace debates as opportunities for growth, turning courage into fuel for innovation.
• We are Collaborative: True collaboration isn’t only about working together. It’s about lifting one another up to succeed collectively. We are team-oriented and communicate with empathy and respect. We challenge each other and conduct positive conflict resolution. We are being transparent about our goals and results. And together, we’re unstoppable.
• We are Customer Centric: Our customers are at the heart of everything we do. We actively listen and prioritize the success of our customers, and every decision we make is driven by how we can better serve, support, and empower them to succeed. When our customers win, we win.

Concerned that you don’t meet every qualification above?

title: QA Developer
description:
Introduction

A career in IBM Software means you’ll be part of a team that transforms our customer’s challenges into solutions.

Seeking new possibilities and always staying curious, we are a team dedicated to creating the world’s leading AI-powered, cloud-native software solutions for our customers. Our renowned legacy creates endless global opportunities for our IBMers, so the door is always open for those who want to grow their career.

IBM’s product and technology landscape includes Research, Software, and Infrastructure. Entering this domain positions you at the heart of IBM, where growth and innovation thrive.

Your Role And Responsibilities

As a QA (Quality Assurance) /Test Developer you will be designing better ways to identify potential weak spots, inefficiencies, and issues within software systems. This position will work closely with development teams and other test engineers in the implementation and delivery of software products that meet rigorous quality standards, budgets, and timelines.

You will play a key role by delivering quality functions for development teams within test driven framework. Your scope will include Test Plan Development, Test Case Execution, Automation Testing, Data Creation, API Validation and incorporating test automation in the CI/CD pipelines.

Your Primary Responsibilities Include
• Selenium Test Automation Proficiency: Have experience with Selenium test automation.
• JAVA Proficiency: Possess knowledge with JAVA programming language.
• API Testing and Automation Familiarity: Hands-on experience in API testing and API automation.
• Agile Development Methodologies: Familiarity with agile development methodologies.

Preferred Education

Bachelor's Degree

Required Technical And Professional Expertise
• 3-5 years of experience in software development testing, product testing
• A minimum of 3 years Hands-on experience in UI and API automation
• Demonstrated communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills
• Hands-on exposure to Locust or similar performance/load testing tools.
• Good understanding of HTTP protocols, REST APIs, and web application architectures.
• Familiarity with monitoring tools (e.g., Grafana, Prometheus) is a plus.
• Basic scripting knowledge (Python preferred) for test automation.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Good communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.

Preferred Technical And Professional Experience

Understanding of CI/CD tools like Jenkins
• Automation Frameworks: Proficiency with API testing and API automation in other Automation frameworks, such as Playwright etc.
• Cloud/Container skills: Familiarity with cloud and container technologies, including Docker, Kubernetes, Red Hat OpenShift, etc.
• Programming Languages/Tools: Python, Jenkins, Linux, Locust, Playwright

title: Quality Assurance Analyst
description:
Job Description:

We are seeking a detail-obsessed and driven QA Analyst to help uphold the highest standards of quality and reliability on our flagship mobile franchise, Jackpot Party Casino.

This is a fully Remote position.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing and executing tests on new features, tools, and game content to ensure they meet exacting standards, especially around high-impact, revenue-sensitive areas.

Key Responsibilities include ensuring all software is functioning as intended with an exceptional level of detail and accuracy, creating, maintaining, and executing test plans and test cases across new and existing game content, tools, and platforms, documenting and tracking issues using bug tracking software (e.g., JIRA) from discovery through resolution, collaborating with developers, designers, artists, and product managers to identify potential quality risks early, reproducing and isolating complex issues to support engineering resolution efforts, generating clear and concise QA documentation, reports, and feedback summaries, identifying gaps in test coverage and proactively suggesting process improvements, owning the quality of assigned areas - functionality, usability, and player experience.

LiveOps QA Responsibilities include ensuring quality and stability of all live operations deliveries across mobile and web platforms, collaborating with Product, Monetization, and Config teams to understand testing requirements and priorities, testing configured Live Events (before and after they go live), covering economy setups, asset triggers, segmentation logic, and campaign flows, validating integrated assets & bundles in Unity across relevant branches, triaged live issues requiring dev fixes, release candidates (server/client/admin code), TOMBs and feature branches delivered from slot dev teams, monitoring and testing live issue resolutions, hotfixes, and deployment-ready changes, performing calendar-based validations, including weekends and holidays, as part of on-call support.

Feature QA Responsibilities include ensuring quality delivery of new features, enhancements, and integrations, participating in Feature Sprint Cycles and tracking progress via test planning and execution, writing and maintaining Test Plans and Test Cases in Xray, executing tests across environments: Dev, Stage, Prod, Hotfix, validating feature branches and conducting bug research, logging and triaging bugs, including those from stakeholder feedback, owning test cycles for P0/P1/P2 issues, QA sign-offs, and build readiness checks, supporting automation by building/extend test automation tools and scripts, contributing to admin tool validation & enhancements, optimizing regression cycles with automated coverage tracking.

title: QA Engineer – POS Devices (Bengaluru, IN)
description:
About The Job

About the Role

We are looking for a skilled QA Engineer with hands-on experience testing POS (Point of Sale) devices, specifically those built with IM30 or Adyen. The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of POS workflows, be able to identify potential failure scenarios, and ensure seamless payment experiences.

Key Responsibilities
• Perform functional, regression, and integration testing on POS devices (preferably IM30, Adyen).
• Identify and document all possible failure points and edge cases for POS transactions.
• Develop, maintain, and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases.
• Collaborate with development and product teams to resolve defects and improve quality.
• Work on automation testing frameworks (a plus).
• Ensure compliance with payment industry standards and security guidelines.

Required Skills & Experience
• 2–4 years of QA experience with POS devices.
• Strong knowledge of IM30 or Adyen-based POS terminals.
• Ability to analyze POS transaction flows and identify failure scenarios.
• Experience writing detailed test cases and test scripts.
• Familiarity with automation tools (e.g., Selenium, Appium, or similar) – nice to have.
• Strong problem-solving and debugging skills.
• Excellent communication and documentation skills.

Nice to Have

Knowledge of payment gateway integrations and transaction protocols (EMV, NFC, etc.).

Experience with API testing (Postman, REST, etc.).

Apply for this job

title: Product Engineer I - Quality Assurance
description:
Experian India is looking for an experienced and meticulous Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for conducting comprehensive testing, analyzing data, and writing test cases to ensure our products and services meet the highest standards of quality and performance. You will validate functionality across multiple platforms, identify vulnerabilities, and provide actionable insights to improve overall solutions.

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in QA, with a minimum of 4 years of relevant experience. Strong proficiency in programming languages like Java, C++, and Python, as well as expertise in writing unit and integration tests, is required. Certifications such as CSTE, ISTQB Agile Tester, or CAST are highly desirable

What you’ll need to bring along (Your prior experience & Expertise)
• Bachelor's degree in computer programming, software development, or a related field.
• A minimum of 4 years of experience as a software tester or quality assurance specialist.
• Demonstrated ability to test and deliver quality software across multiple platforms, with a solid understanding of industry-standard procedures and tools.
• Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, C++, and Python.
• Skilled in writing unit, Functional and integration test cases.
• Possession of relevant software testing certifications, including Certified Software Tester (CSTE), ISTQB Agile Tester Certification, or Certified associate in software Testing (CAST).
• knowledge of Automation testing (such as TOSCA /Selenium)

What you’ll be doing (Job responsibilities for this role)
• Conduct comprehensive software testing, analyze data, write test cases, and collaborate effectively with developers.
• Validate software functionality across various operating systems, browsers, and devices to ensure the software meets quality standards and user needs.
• Identify and test for security vulnerabilities, providing actionable input to enhance product solutions.
• Communicate software testing results to stakeholders while suggesting opportunities for improvement.

title: Software Engineer in Test
description:
Cvent is a leading meetings, events, and hospitality technology provider with more than 4,800 employees and ~22,000 customers worldwide, including 53% of the Fortune 500. Founded in 1999, Cvent delivers a comprehensive event marketing and management platform for marketers and event professionals and offers software solutions to hotels, special event venues, and destinations to help them grow their group/MICE and corporate travel business. Our technology brings millions of people together at events around the world. In short, we’re transforming the meetings and events industry through innovative technology that powers the human connection.

The DNA of Cvent is our people, and our culture has an emphasis on fostering intrapreneurship – a system that encourages Cventers to think and act like individual entrepreneurs and empowers them to take action, embrace risk, and make decisions as if they had founded the company themselves. At Cvent, we value the diverse perspectives that each individual brings. Whether working with a team of colleagues or with clients, we ensure that we foster a culture that celebrates differences and builds on shared connections.

Software Development Engineer in Testing

What you’ll be doing:
• Create end-to-end automated tests for comprehensive test coverage
• Design, develop, and implement performance and load tests.
• Troubleshoot and analyze the results of performance/load tests, sharing root causes with team.
• Improve code coverage of automated tests using code quality tools.
• Analyze and enhance the coverage of automated security and accessibility tests.
• Collaborate with Developers and DevOps to integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines.
• Assist in creating test strategy and plans.
• Provide usability and functional feedback to the product team.
• Assist sprint teams in raising overall quality and increasing velocity.
• Participate in Sprint scrum ceremonies, including grooming, planning, and demos.
• Collaborate with the Automation team to enhance Cvent's testing tools and frameworks.
• Bring up ideas and contribute to achieving high software quality goals.

What you’ll need for the role:
• Possess a B.E./B.Tech/MCA regular degree from a reputed institute/university
• Have 2 to 4 years of relevant experience.
• Minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience in web application testing & writing automation tests using web automation frameworks like Selenium, Playwright, etc.
• Possess at least 6 months of hands-on experience in API automation testing.
• Proficiently use developer tools and IDEs, such as Intellij/Eclipse/VSCode and GIT.
• Demonstrate experience working in a CI/CD environment, like Jenkins, for executing and integrating automated tests.
• Possess strong troubleshooting and analytical skills for effective technical problem-solving.
• Possess good hands-on experience in developing and monitoring performance automated tests (using Gatling, Sitespeed, JMeter, or similar tools).
• Demonstrate good programming skills, with Java preferred.
• Demonstrate proficiency in leveraging AI tools and Generative AI technologies to optimize testing activities, like automation scripting, test data generation, and test case design, etc.
• Bring working experience with tools/technologies like Junit, TestNG, Jest, Karate, which is a plus

description:

3-5 years’ experience

About Aliaxis

Aliaxis is a global leader in advanced piping systems for building, infrastructure, industrial and agriculture applications. The company provides communities around the world with sustainable innovative solutions for water and energy, leading the industry in a way that anticipates the rapidly evolving needs of its customers and of society. With a global workforce of 15000+ employees, Aliaxis offers specific solutions that meet our customers most demanding needs across the globe. Aliaxis is active through leading local brands and operating in over 40 countries, combining local solutions with global innovation and operational excellence. The company is private owned, with its global headquarters in Brussels, Belgium.

Aliaxis India Headquartered in Bangalore with brand name of Ashirvad by Aliaxis has over 1500+ channel partners, 60000 dealers and approximately 500 sales personnel spread all over the country. There is a dedicated helpline number where you can reach Ashirvad Pipes for any help and our representative will reach out to you for any advice or help which you might need in connection with our range of products, installation, availability and prices

Role Summary: The Site quality engineer will be responsible for ensuring top-quality standards in manufacturing processes. He will oversee and ensure the quality of compounding processes at our manufacturing site. The role involves monitoring batch formation, auditing chemical addition sequences, validating process parameters, and driving continuous improvement initiatives, conducting process and system audits, monitoring SPC, and addressing non-conformances. This position will ensure quality of the CPVC & PVC compounds. The ideal candidate should have strong knowledge of APQP, PPAP, FMEA, ISO 9001, and excellent communication and presentation skills.

Roles And Responsibility

Production Quality Assurance
• Ensure compounding is performed strictly as per BOM (Bill of Materials) recipes
• Monitor batch formation to verify accurate weight measurements.
• Audit and verify the sequence of chemical additions during compounding.
• Establish and improve correlations between critical parameters: Temperature, Time, and Torque (TTT)
• Raise and manage Non-Conformance Reports (NCRs) for any process deviations.
• Collaborate in the development and revision of Work Instructions, SOPs, and Process Validation documents.
• Act as a key member in raw material trials, chemical evaluations, and recipe changes.
• Conduct Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and implement Corrective and Preventive Actions (CAPA) for non-conformances.
• Perform testing of critical parameters of compound.
• Maintain and regularly update MIS reports and IMS documentation.

Continuous Improvement
• Ensure continual improvement is planned for the plant to achieve zero defects in the process.
• Perform the CAPA sustenance audit and Monitor the functioning of Poka-yoke / engineering controls are working at all times as per the SOP.

Role Specific Competencies

1 Strong understanding of APQP, PPAP, FMEA, Control Plan, and SPC concepts. Solid knowledge of ISO 9001 requirements and implementation. Hands-on experience with manufacturing processes of plastic pipes and pipe fittings. Accountability for product quality across all satellite manufacturing plants. Proven ability to drive Zero PPM both in-house and at customer end. Expertise in RCA and CAPA to prevent recurrence of quality issues. Effective trainer with the ability to educate plant personnel on quality concepts. Responsible for obtaining and maintaining Customer Approvals, BIS, IAPMO NSF, NABL Certifications. Execute SOPs to ensure desired product quality and timely delivery. Excellent written and verbal communication skills; adept at data presentation and reporting.

Core Values for the Role (Aliaxis Values): Remove if not applicable to the role
• We Care.
• We Dare.
• We Deliver.

title: Lead Automation Testing_Vice President_Quality Engineering
description:
Morgan Stanley

Lead Automation Testing_Vice President_Quality Engineering

Profile Description

Lead Quality Engineer for Middle Office service and data components for Wealth Management. Ensuring sound risk and quality control with use of innovation. Provide end to end testing solutions for services, data, batches and all related components with full confidence. Drive efficiencies using automation. Collaborate with tech and business partners and co-own the success of applications under purview.

Wealth Management Tech

Wealth Management Technology is responsible for the design, development, delivery, and support of the technical solutions behind the products and services used by the Morgan Stanley Wealth Management Business. Practice areas include: Analytics, Intelligence, & Data Technology (AIDT), Client Platforms, Core Technology Services (CTS), Financial Advisor Platforms, Global Banking Technology (GBT), Investment Solutions Technology (IST), Institutional Wealth and Corporate Solutions Technology (IWCST), Technology Delivery Management (TDM), User Experience (UX), and the CAO team.

WM Middle Office & Market Data

Middle office is a core foundation for E*TRADE. It provides the platform with key capabilities to support customer digital journey from opening an account, funding the account, trade and order management, portfolio/balances and risk management on all digital channels. It also provides the capabilities for E*TRADE B2B stock plan business to manage participants lifecycle.

QA Engineering

This is a Vice President position within our QA Engineering function.

Morgan Stanley is an industry leader in financial services, known for mobilizing capital to help governments, corporations, institutions, and individuals around the world achieve their financial goals.

At Morgan Stanley India, we support the Firm’s global businesses, with critical presence across Institutional Securities, Wealth Management, and Investment management, as well as in the Firm’s infrastructure functions of Technology, Operations, Finance, Risk Management, Legal and Corporate & Enterprise Services. Morgan Stanley has been rooted in India since 1993, with campuses in both Mumbai and Bengaluru. We empower our multi-faceted and talented teams to advance their careers and make a global impact on the business. For those who show passion and grit in their work, there’s ample opportunity to move across the businesses for those who show passion and grit in their work.

Interested in joining a team that’s eager to create, innovate and make an impact on the world? Read on…

• Strong Leadership, leading by example and building high performing team
• Transforming team by means of improving culture, strengthening processes, coverage, right use of automation and innovation
• At least 6 years' relevant experience would generally be expected to find the skills required for this role.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills
• Sense of ownership, accountability and flexibility with focus on problem solving

What You Can Expect From Morgan Stanley

We are committed to maintaining the first-class service and high standard of excellence that have defined Morgan Stanley for over 89 years. Our values - putting clients first, doing the right thing, leading with exceptional ideas, committing to diversity and inclusion, and giving back - aren’t just beliefs, they guide the decisions we make every day to do what's best for our clients, communities and more than 80,000 employees in 1,200 offices across 42 countries. title: Manual Testing
description:
**Manual Tester / QA Engineer – Job Description**

**Role Overview**

As a Manual Tester, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of software applications by manually executing test cases, identifying defects, and collaborating with cross\\-functional teams to deliver high\\-quality products.

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Test Planning \\& Design**: Analyze software requirements and create detailed test plans and test cases to ensure comprehensive coverage of functionalities.
* **Test Execution**: Manually execute test cases on various platforms, including web and mobile applications, to identify defects and ensure software behaves as expected.
* **Defect Identification \\& Reporting**: Identify, document, and track software defects using bug tracking tools like Jira or Bugzilla, providing detailed steps to reproduce and relevant information.
* **Regression Testing**: Perform regression testing to ensure that new code changes do not negatively impact existing functionality.
* **Collaboration**: Work closely with developers, business analysts, and product owners to understand requirements and ensure quality throughout the software development lifecycle.
* **Documentation \\& Reporting**: Maintain detailed documentation of test cases, test results, and any relevant testing artifacts, and provide regular updates on testing progress and outcomes.

**Required Skills \\& Qualifications**

* **Educational Background**: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* **Experience**: 2\\+ years of experience in manual software testing.
* **Technical Skills**:
* Proficiency in creating clear and comprehensive test cases.
* Familiarity with test case management and defect tracking tools like Jira, Bugzilla, TestRail, or HP ALM.
* Basic knowledge of SQL for database validation.
* Experience using tools like Postman or SoapUI for API testing.
* Understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and mobile operating systems (iOS, Android).
* Ability to use browser developer tools for debugging

Job Type: Full\\-time

Education:

title: Quality Assurance Executive
description:
**What identifies an Quality Assurance Executive (QA Tester)?**

A **QA** plays a supportive role in ensuring the quality of software systems by assisting the QA team in executing test plans, identifying bugs, and maintaining documentation. They should possess **strong English communication skills**, enabling them to understand technical documents, report bugs clearly, and collaborate efficiently. Coming from a **strong technical education background**, the QA is expected to have foundational knowledge in testing concepts and a keen eye for detail. They participate in manual testing, support automation efforts, and are eager to learn tools and processes used in the QA lifecycle.

**Contributions of Quality Assurance Executive (QA Tester)**

The contributions of QA testers in the tech engineering field are indispensable for delivering reliable, high\\-quality products. Here are the key contributions they make:

· Performance Manual Test Cases

· Bug Detection and Documentation

· Regression Testing

· UAT and Agile Ceremonies

· Test Documentation and Reporting

**Expectations for an Quality Assurance Executive (QA Tester)**

· **Strong English Proficiency:** Ability to communicate clearly in both spoken and written English, especially for test reporting and cross\\-functional discussions.

· **Technical Background:** Must be from a reputed technical institute with foundational knowledge in programming or software testing.

· **Understanding of QA Concepts:** Familiarity with SDLC, STLC, test case design, and bug life cycle.

· **Manual Testing Skills:** Ability to execute test cases and report defects accurately.

· **Basic Documentation Abilities:** Prepare clear and concise reports on testing progress and findings.

· **Eagerness to Learn:** Willingness to understand QA tools and techniques like Linear, Jira, Selenium, Excel, Postmen, Node.js \\& React.js (basic understanding).

· **Team Collaboration:** Actively work with developers and testers to ensure software reliability.

· **Participation in Agile Meetings:** Share updates on testing tasks and assist in sprint activities.

**Capabilities of a Quality Assurance Executive (QA Tester)**

· **Education:** Pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor’s/Master’s in Computer Science, IT, or related field from a recognized institution.

· **English Communication:** Fluent and clear in verbal and written English.

· **QA Tools Familiarity:** Exposure to bug tracking or test management tools (like Linear, Jira, Selenium, Excel, Postmen) is a plus.

· **Curiosity \\& Detail\\-Oriented Approach:** Passion for quality, attention to detail, and a learner mindset.

· **Internship Experience:** Prior internship or academic project in QA/testing (optional but preferred).

· **Internship Experience**: Any QA/Testing certification in Manual or Automation is a plus.

· **Adaptability**: Able to work independently as well as with teams in a dynamic environment.
